Articles.Content:
I created a model aircraft in KSP of an Airbus A320, It looks good.

If you don't have FAR, Download the plane and test it, leave a reply saying if it worked or not.

It is very stable, it has a tendency to pitch down while flying at low speeds, So, watch out that landing!

Here are the images:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

STATS:

Cruising speed: 300-350 m/s

Max Speed: Test it by yourself!

Cruising Altitude: 10000-15000 m

Max Altitude: Around 20000 m

ACTION GROUPS:

1: Decrease flap deflection (raise flaps)

2: Increase flap deflection (lower flaps)

Brakes: Activate spoilers (airbrakes)

THESE ONLY WORK WITH FAR!

DOWNLOAD:

Here!

Edited July 10, 2014 by gmpd2000

Hello, that is a good plane!

The only things that are worth advicing are that you can remove those struts from the wings, they are just adding drag.

And that you should fix the action groups, right now only one side is working, when you set an action group and move that part the other parts created by simmetry aren't assigned to the group.

It's overstable at too high speeds, but that is not much of an issue at all.

This is a very resistent airplane, one of the rougher ones.

After removing the cubic struts and gaining a bit of extra speed, it was possible to break it, after some tries, abusing yaw.

So yeah, it's basically unbreakable under uses far from the normal, which is great.

We at Roaken want to see more of your planes!

Edited July 10, 2014 by Roaken Corporation

Thanks, I've updated the download with a fixed version, I have some other planes in my save, but they are in development (balancing the lift, making more room for cargo, etc) I should have another plane here soon.

Also, if i remove the struts from the wing, wing wobbles and destroys itself unless you put struts between the wings, wich don't always attach.

Edited July 10, 2014 by gmpd2000
